title: Gitea
name: Gitea
overview:
Gitea is a painless self-hosted Git service. It is similar to GitHub, Bitbucket, and GitLab. It is a community managed lightweight code hosting solution written in Go. Gitea's minimal requirements allow it to run seamlessly on inexpensive hardware like a Raspberry Pi. Features:


  - Fully self-hosted and private
  - Issue tracker
  - Account/Organization/Repository management
  - Tor support
  - Repository Git hooks/deploy keys
  - Repository issues, pull requests and wiki
  - Add/Remove repository collaborators
  - Gravatar and custom source
  - Admin panel
releaseNotes:
This update includes important security fixes and several improvements:
  - Security fixes for release attachments, organization project permissions, and repository privacy
  - Additional permission checks for stopwatch operations and LFS locks
  - Fixed bugs with auto merge cancellation and attachment deletion
  - Improved markdown handling during IME composition
  - Fixed issues with pull request comparisons and notifications pagination
  - Resolved problems with release migration and stats synchronization
  - Fixed WebAuthn error checking and authorized principals writing
  - Enhanced API support for commit statuses with slashes in references
  - Various bug fixes and stability improvements


Full release notes: https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/releases
